issues.description: The problem statement / UML declares ExcellenceLand.excellentEnough as a boolean, and the tasks explicitly state that ExcellenceLand has a private List<Ride> rides attribute. In the solution, the attribute 'excellentEnough' is implemented as a String (and the constructor and getter use String). This is a type mismatch for a core attribute and will confuse students and break tests that expect a boolean for 'excellentEnough' (and the constructor/getter signatures).
issues.suggested_fix: Change the type of 'excellentEnough' in the solution (and in any template/example code) from String to boolean, update the constructor parameter to accept a boolean (keeping parameter order: double excellencyLevel, boolean excellentEnough, List<Ride> rides), and change the getter getExcellentEnough() to return boolean. Ensure the 'rides' attribute is declared as private List<Ride> as described in the tasks.
